title: Gemma Collins wears sequinned jacket and dances at University of Kent
text:
Gemma Collins thrilled freshers when she hit the dancefloor at University of Kent's student union on Saturday.

The TOWIE star, 38, threw caution to the wind as she decided to show off her dance moves surrounded by students during her appearance at Venue nightclub.

In a video uploaded by Venue, Gemma can be seen shimmying and throwing her hair around while security guards tried to keep back excitable fans.

Dancing the night away: Gemma Collins thrilled freshers when she hit the dancefloor at University of Kent's student union on Saturday

Gemma lived up to her diva status as she channelled her inner Beyoncé with her killer moves.

The Diva Forever star caught the eye in a sequinned pink and black zebra print bomber jacket.

Gemma layered the statement jacket atop of a stretchy black vest, which hugged her curves.

Dazzling display: The Diva Forever star caught the eye in a sequinned pink and black zebra print bomber jacket

The former TOWIE star completed her look with skinny black jeans and black mesh peep toe heels.

Gemma wore her platinum blonde hair in voluminous curls and enhanced her golden tan with a full face of make-up.

Gemma's nightclub appearance comes after she revealed she was so poor growing up in Essex that she 'never knew what a toaster was,' because her parents couldn't afford one.

Boogie: The TOWIE star, 38, threw caution to the wind as she decided to show off her dance moves surrounded by students during her appearance at Venue nightclub

Detailing her childhood on her BBC podcast, the GC explained that she and her brother toasted bread on forks over the fire, and didn't even know there was another way to make toast.

Gemma, who is estimated to have a net worth of £2.7 million, said: 'My parents were very strapped for cash when we were growing up. We did not have a toaster growing up.

'Me and my brother Russell used to get our forks in the bread, put it on the gas fire and that's how we made toast.

'I never knew what a toaster was, it was only as I got older, we got a toaster. I had a happy childhood, I didn't know about money then.'

But things are very different for Gemma now, who certainly enjoys the finer things in life, jetting around the world and buying designer handbags
description: Gemma Collins thrilled freshers when she hit the dancefloor at University of Kent's student union on Saturday.
